New Records: Andrés Giménez has his fourth career walk-off plate appearance, and his second this season.
Key Match Events: Andrés Giménez drills an RBI single into right field to score José Ramírez for Cleveland's second straight walk-off victory
Cleveland relievers toss 5 2/3 scoreless innings, holding the Twins hitless and striking out eight

Minnesota threatens to score in the top of the 10th but Eli Morgan retires Carlos Correa on a pop to first base in foul territory and escapes the inning when Byron Buxton sends a fly ball to Lane Thomas in right for the final out
Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians were not a popular pick to reach the playoffs when the season started, but have spent the last 23 weeks perched atop the American League Central Division
Post-Match Reflections: First-year manager Stephen Vogt said until he saw Giménez's line drive hit green grass, he had not allowed himself to get excited about reaching the postseason

Vogt said 'We just started hugging, Alby (bench coach Craig Albernaz) and just what this group has been through. This is really special. The goal is to get in and then from here we keep pushing. Once you get in, you have a chance.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians (89-65) are 10-3 in extra-inning games and notched their 42nd comeback win while improving the best home record in the AL to 48-28
The team will head out on their final road trip of the regular season with three games in St. Louis beginning Friday at Busch Stadium
